title: The new sausage stew
description: This one-pan wonder can be left alone to cook itself. Well, almost.
instructions: Heat the oil in a large flameproof casserole and fry the sausages on a medium heat until evenly browned on all sides. Remove and set aside.
Add the pancetta to the pan and fry until crisp. Remove and place with the sausages.
Brown the shallots, carrots, and garlic, then return the sausages and pancetta to the pan.
Add the crushed juniper berries, wine, and 3 sprigs of rosemary; season and bring to a simmer. Cover with a lid and simmer very gently for 30 mins.
Remove the lid and cook for a further 15 minutes to allow the sauce to reduce slightly.
Using a slotted spoon, remove the sausages and vegetables from the pan, mix the butter with the flour, and slowly whisk into the sauce until thickened and glossy.
Stir in the redcurrant jelly; return the sausages and vegetables to the pan and mix well. Serve with a creamy mash.
imageDesc: A pot filled with warm sausage stew, and rosemary scattered on top.
